York women comfortably defeat Hull

York women's rugby players carried on their winning start to the season with a 31-10 win over Hull University (Thumbnail credit Image: Courtesy of York Women's Rugby Club)

Women's lacrosse continue winning start to season

York's women's lacrosse side continued their winning start to the season with a 9-8 victory over Newcastle seconds (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Fencers chalk up first victory of the season

The men's fencers registered their first win of the season, defeating the University of Leeds 131-86. (Thumbnail credit Image: Charlie Woods)

Mixed fortunes for men's and women's basketball in cup

York's men basketball players lost out to Sheffield Hallam seconds in the first round of the cup earlier today. (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Golf's top spot up for grabs in Shanghai

Four of the world's top golfers could take the world number one spot at the upcoming WGC-HSBC Champions event. Sam Morgan assesses just who that person will be. (Thumbnail credit Lee Westwood. The world's number one golfer. Image: zrim via Flickr Creative Commons)

Netballers produce magnificient display to knock-out Northumbria

The women's netballers clinched a thrilling 37-35 victory over Northumbria University today, a side who are two divisions above the White Rose (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

Women's rugby fall short against HYMS

York's women rugby players faced Hull York Medical School in a friendly on Sunday. Despite losing 15-5, it was a game of many positives for York. (Thumbnail credit Image: Eric Kenny)

James mount comeback to win 2-1

Goals from James Offord and Josh Brownlow allowed James to come back from behind and win 2-1 against Langwith on Sunday morning. (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Halifax battle to 1-0 win over dogged Wentworth

Halifax laboured to a 1-0 win over a determined Wentworth eleven on a damp Sunday morning. (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Alcuin brought back to earth after Goodricke win

Alcuin, last year's College Cup champions, lost 3-1 to an ever improving Goodricke on Sunday morning. (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Hat-trick hero Kirk seals 3-1 Derwent victory

The second match-day of College Football saw Matt Hallam's Derwent win 3-1, thanks to a hat-trick from David Kirk. (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Nouse Sports Podcast

By James Bithell

The third edition of the Nouse Sports Podcast is here. This week we discuss York's mixed bag of BUCS results on Wednesday, question why so many serious injuries are happening and look forward to the Ashes. (Thumbnail credit Image: Aaste Haukvik Traen)

Men's Volleyballers lose out to Leeds Met Carnegie

By James Bithell

The men's first Volleyballers lost in straight sets to a vastly more experienced Leeds Met Carnegie side on Wednesday afternoon. (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Basketball firsts denied in thriller

The men's basketball firsts narrowly lost out 55-51 to Huddersfield in a brutal encounter on Wednesday (Thumbnail credit Image: Sam Newsome)

Women's fencers claim first BUCS victory

By James Bithell

The women's fencers wrapped up their first win of their season yesterday, defeating the University of Manchester. (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

York's footballers pegged back to 3-3 draw

By James Bithell

After a resounding 6-1 win last week York's men's firsts threw away the lead to draw 3-3 with Sunderland firsts. (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

Men's hockey firsts hammered by Newcastle

The men's firsts were thrashed 8-0 by a rampant Newcastle firsts on the JLD on Wednesday afternoon. (Thumbnail credit Image: Sam Newsome)

Women's footballers held in frustrating draw

By James Bithell

The women's football team gained a point with a 3-3 draw with newly promoted Hull University. (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

Women's rugby abandoned due to injury

By James Bithell

York's women's rugby team got their campaign off and running on Wednesday, but an injury to a Leeds player meant the game was abandoned. (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Goodricke start the season with a win over Langwith

By James Bithell

Goodricke defeat Langwith 4-0 and Joseph Cormack was there to witness the action (Thumbnail credit Image: Sam Newsome)

Halifax kick-off in style against Derwent

By James Bithell

Simon Bromley watched as Derwent came out on the wrong side of a 3-0 loss to Halifax in the opening round of College Football. (Thumbnail credit Image: Sam Newsome)

Alcuin and James contest scrappy draw

By James Bithell

Last year's College Cup champions Alcuin contested a tense 1-1 draw with James on Sunday morning. (Thumbnail credit Image: Sam Newsome)

Vanbrugh hit Wentworth for six

By James Bithell

Richard Costello watches Vanbrugh demolish a plucky Wentworth side 6-0. (Thumbnail credit Image: Sam Newsome)

Men's football seconds humbled on opening day

(Thumbnail credit The men's seconds pictured in action last season. Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Women's seconds off the mark with resounding win

The women's hockey seconds started their season with a fine 10-0 win over Leeds sixths. (Thumbnail credit Image: Sam Newsome)

Return to College Football overshadowed by suspected leg-break

Another serious injury to an Alcuin player cast a pall over the return to College Football on the 22 Acres on Sunday morning. (Thumbnail credit Both players are intent on getting to the ball, but Paul Reiss of Alcuin unfortunately suffers a suspected broken leg in their game against James. Photo credit: Sam Newsome)

Women's fencers battle fixture list difficulties

In a match which shredded the nerves and caught the imagination York's only Premier League competitors, the Women's Fencing Firsts lost their season opener in almost unfeasibly dramatic circumstances last Wednesday (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Sam Newsome)

York's footballers off to a flier as 6-1 win underlines genuine promotion credentials

"I want no exam disruptions, lots of preparation for both sides and no excuses with the weather - I want to wipe the floor with Lancaster". Strong words they may be, but ones that are spoken with the conviction from a president in charge of one of York's strongest clubs (Thumbnail credit Mark Mcleod will be one of the first team members who are crucial this year as they seek to build on a very postive campaign from last season. Photo credit: Peter Iveson)

Cuts to Youth Sport Trust will curb English ambition

As George Osborne announces the government's Spending Review, Sports Correspondent Jake Farrell gets all political and assesses the cuts on sport (Thumbnail credit Will England be able to carry on producing the likes of Jack Wilshere when the government's cuts begin to take affect on grassroots football? Photo credit: Ronnie MacDonald)

The Mixer

What a start to the season it has been for sport at York. TM has rather enjoyed itself, one particular highlight was all and sundry, including messrs Asfahani and Ngwena attempting to dislodge a rugby ball trapped up a tree. Nobody was successful (Thumbnail credit What this picture doesn't show is that the ball was actually thirty yards away. Photo credit: Justyn Hardcastle)
